thread.title: Duchess of Cambridge protected by high-tech police drones during royal visit
thread.title_full: Duchess of Cambridge protected by high-tech police drones during royal visit

title: Duchess of Cambridge protected by high-tech police drones during royal visit
text: XPOSURE•PA The Duchess of Cambridge was watched from the sky during her royal visit Wearing a burgundy suit by French luxury brand Paule Ka, Kate, 35, charmed parents and youngsters during her appearance . It was her first engagement with Action for Children since she took over from the Queen as the charity’s patron in December. She was welcomed to the service, which works with young people and their carers or families to address complex mental health problems, by Ypapanti Galimatakis-Rees, eight, and Chloe Bartlett, 10, who both hugged the Duchess and gave her posies of flowers. Chloe said she had always wanted to meet a member of the Royal Family and had managed to get “five hugs” from Kate. Kate, Duchess of Cambridge in pictures Wed, February 22, 2017 Kate Middleton, Duchess of Cambridge, life in pictures; including royal visits around the world and her most stunning outfits. Getty Images 1 of 386 Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge arrives during her visit to MIST, a child and adolescent mental health project, part of Action for Children which supports vulnerable families in Wales and across the UK Kate also joined in an impromptu game of pool at the centre with service user Craig Davies, 15, who later joked: “She was dreadful.” I am so pleased to meet everyone here and it is so brave for all of you to be sharing your stories Duchess of Cambridge Apart from her poor pool performance, she had one other embarrassing moment when her skirt flew up in the wind. Later, the Duchess visited the Caerphilly Family Intervention Team centre to learn about their work with children with emotional and behavioural difficulties, problems with family relationships and those who have or who are likely to self harm. Together, the two successful projects helped 13,000 children and young people last year. PA The Duchess paid a visit to Action for Children charity Kate spoke with staff at FIT and also met Sir Tony Hawkhead, chief executive of Action for Children. She then met with families who use the centre, including grandmother Christine Jones, 47, and her grandchildren Emily Davies, nine, and Alfie Thomas, seven. Mrs Jones told Kate how FIT had helped her family, including her son Gareth, who had been bullied at school. PA Kate received flowers from the the children she visited The Duchess said: “I am so pleased to meet everyone here and it is so brave for all of you to be sharing your stories.” She spoke to Emily and Alfie about their time at the centre and asked what they enjoyed doing with their grandmother. After hearing they had been to see hit Disney film Moana at the cinema, she replied: “I haven’t seen it. You lucky things. Kate Middleton: Hair & make-up
